column4: now that i have my xpad saved and it works on calibration... is there a program where i can use it in place of keystrokes, even on my desktop?
not just in gaames
now that i have my xpad saved and it works on calibration... is there a program where i can use it in place of keystrokes, even on my desktop?
gnomefreak!
i use the xpad
there is a program like that, i think it's called xkeys
yes, i'm sure it is in there, just forget the name
xkeys is the wrong program, sorry :/
you need qjoypad
probably. search for it...
you'll need to do a manual install then
wait, joy2key is available
^ what gnomefreak said
if you have installed joy2key then you already have enabled universe
joy2key is not a gui app, you must configure it by hand
you must configure joy2key properly. read "man joy2key"
just type "man joy2key" in terminal
about joy2key? i'll help you configure it
no, you must be registered with nickserv
/msg nickserv help
hey you're back, i got disconnected before, sorry about that
i think from your error before, it looked like you tried to read from a none-existing axis on the joystick
there window?
if you're trying to msg me, you need to identify to nickserv again with the password you set earlier
